This area also lends itself less well to problem areas or program titles
without becoming fairly technical. It is expected that programs and heading
might, more than in most cases, be determined by available subject materials such
as might be found at the Msnninger Clinic, or at the psychiatric clinics of some
of our large universitites.
Mr. Harry Milt, Director of Public Relations for The National Association for
Mental Health, Inc., of 1790 Broadway, New York 19, New York, and Mr. Jack Nefcer of
the Mental Health Materials Center, at the same address, have urged that we arrange
for a meeting with them there for adequate consultation which they do not feel
can be adequately done by mail. At that time lists of consultants can be finalised.
Dr. Rudolph G. Noviek, Psychiatric Consultant to the Illinois Society of Mental
Health is one whose name has been favorably mentioned. He has indicated in a letter
to me his interest and willingness to cooperate, subject to further discussions in
person. Others suggested include Dr. Dana Farnsworth of Harvard University, Mr.
Jack Glidervell of St. Louis, Dr. Qjemann of Iowa State, Mr. Robert Sutherland of
the Hogg Foundation of Austin, and a representative of the National Congress of the
PTA, which is also planning a project in Mental Health. As indispensable possible
resource people the following would also need to be consulted;
